description.narrative: Restorative justice and violence prevention approaches are enhanced and integrated into the work of social and justice institutions, which contributes to Access To Justice, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Technical Assistance - operating costs -- Staff Costs

participating-org.narrative: BELARUSIAN STATE PEDAGOGICAL UNIVER EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION
MINSK CHILDREN S PSYCHONEUROLOGICAL REHABILITATION CENTER
REPUBLICAN SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH CENTER MOTHER AND CHILD

mailing-address.narrative: 22A Krasnoarmejskaya Street 220030 Minsk Republic of Belarus

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly police and justice sector services
Ending violence against women and girls
Justice sector workforce strengthening and capacity building (including police)
Justice, law and order policy, planning and administration
Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
